start.speaker: Factor
start.text:
We pretend the Ladder is a tool.
But tools don’t get hungry.

This is a contract you can feel in your teeth: in Hollow City, the Authority has written a rule that decides who gets to be real today.

Tell me how you will answer it. Not what you want — what you will pay.

choices.text: Speak the first line of the contract (begin).
Say nothing. Watch how silence signs itself.
Bind yourself to the Clause of Ink (become name-shaped).
Bind yourself to the Clause of Blood (become take-shaped).
Bind yourself to the Clause of Silence (become withhold-shaped).
Bind yourself to the Clause of Debt (become owe-shaped).
Bind yourself to the Clause of Witness (become witness-shaped).

hinge.speaker: Factor
hinge.text:
There are five ways the world keeps score, and none of them are kind.

Ink asks you to owe it.
Blood asks you to take it.
Silence asks you to withhold it.
Debt asks you to owe it.
Witness asks you to witness it.

Choose, and don’t flatter yourself: even refusal is a clause.

choices.text: Answer in Debt: choose duty even if it stains you.
Answer against Debt: choose restraint and carry the possession anyway.
Invoke your Clause. Let the Authority hear the shape of your vow.

vow.speaker: Factor
vow.text:
Good. Then say it plainly.

If you step forward, the Ladder remembers your weight.
If you step back, it remembers the shape of your absence.

choices.text: Leave it open a moment longer. Breathe. Then close it.

end.speaker: Narrator
end.text:
The contract closes with a sound like a book shutting in an empty room.

You can walk away, but you cannot walk back into who you were.
